website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight but durable, this fork gets work done without wearing out your wrists and forearms.
pros: Fiberglass handle cuts back on weight
Useful for a variety of purposes, including spreading mulch, picking up weeds, and moving manure
cons: Might be too heavy for a smaller person to use for a full day of work

customer_reviews.title: it's OK
customer_reviews.text: its a strong fork but the head is not welded to the sleeve so it will eventually fail just like my old one, if the head were welded to the sleeve it would last forever, if it lasts as long as my old one I will be happy...I might take it to my welder and have him weld it ....only friction is holding the pitchfork head in, just amazes me that such a quality product is held together with friction, I would say most of the 5 star reviewers have not used the pitch fork much......all the pitch forks I looked at are made like this...do not leave it out in the weather rain will make it fail much sooner
customer_reviews.author: E. Money

customer_reviews.title: Must have for mulching
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this fork specifically for moving 20 yards of mulch which is about 2/3 of a dump truck. It takes about 4 full scoops to fill a normal wheel barrow. A flat head shovel would take about 20 scoops and you would have to fight the edge catching on the mulch. This was solid throughout the whole process. We originally went to Fleet Farm and saw their version was 65 dollars so we decided to get this one for half that. We did later see one at Menards for slightly cheaper but not sure how it compares. Overall I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: mdpautzke

customer_reviews.title: forks bent
customer_reviews.text: Size is good problem is the forks bent in the ground. No, I do not have the might of Zeus, so in my opinion it failed me. If you have tough ground look for a much stronger steel than this. If it never bent it was good for a few holes.
customer_reviews.author: 2shoes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Tried several forks before I found this one, and this thing is pure evil. It will pick up anything in it's way, tons of wet leaves, and you can throw them WAY over fence into your neighbors yard. Amazing tool!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Handle is not solid. I expected a stronger handle.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality product that might last 10-20 years depending on use. If I had known the fiberglass handle was hollow like PVC pipe, I would have bought a cheaper product with a wooden handle. I expected a solid handle with bend proof tines. I expect it to fail when subjected to abuse like prying at roots. I have a fiberglass handled maul/axe which is about 35 years old. This spading fork won't last that long the way I'll use it. But... it's lighter weight will be nicer right up until the moment it breaks. You might be happy with the weight/strength compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Danger Brown

customer_reviews.title: We like it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this $28 manure fork and another $60 manure fork at the same time on amazon. Wife and I went out to use them both for the first time to clean stalls today. One of the tines bent on the $60 one after about an hour use. I was able to bend it mostly back, but it has definitely compromised the integrity and continually have to bend it back into position to make it usable. This one is holding up pretty well. To early to tell after one day use, but we might get another of these $28 manure forks which is an overall better design other than the the straight handle, we prefer a "D stile" handle .
customer_reviews.author: dbworld

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Built.  Wish the tines were sharper.
customer_reviews.text: As with many tools such as shovels etc., they arrive dull. I like the quality of this Spade Fork but.... the tines don't cut into clay hardly at all. Needs to be sharper and more spear-like on each tine. I just can't see this spade fork penetrating any but the most maleable soils. I'm going to experiment with a grinder on the tips.
customer_reviews.author: Peep

customer_reviews.title: More great expectations - and delivery!
customer_reviews.text: This is another great gardening tool I purchased! I have hardware cloth so I cannot use a broadfork to aerate my soil. No worries - this tool will make that job easier and more comfortable. My clay soil has been well amended, and I am sure that it will do just fine with this soil prep. My tool also arrived in great packaging and arrived as expected. Very happy about this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Beatty-Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Early signs of trouble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pitch fork in hopes of it being a long-term reliable tool. My older wooden pitch fork separated between the fork and handle. After a few months of light use with this fork, the silver ring between the fiberglass handle and the metal fork came loose. I feel like it's a matter of time before I experience more serious trouble. It's really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wieringa

customer_reviews.title: Well made and useful!
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made, sturdy and works as expected. Lighter weight than other sturdy yard tools. Likely to be around for a long time doing what it is made to do! Makes moving yard debris around so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy T.

customer_reviews.title: Very large / wide fork
customer_reviews.text: I love this fork for moving mulch. It is three times as wide as my garden fork I had been using. It is well made and should remain sturdy and usable for years. Reasonable weight; not real light but not heavy either. If you spread mulch every year, buy this fork. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyandSam

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: With very little use only for spreading mulch, the fork came off the pole. Seller sent me a refund. Only odd thing, I was dealing with an individual who sent me his personal check. I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: L. John Morelli

customer_reviews.title: Super compost turner
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fork for turning my compost pile. I am a woman 5'5" and not that big and this made me feel like a super woman just easily turning the pile!!
customer_reviews.author: hghquality

customer_reviews.title: This pitch fork is perfect weight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this pitch fork, because it is sturdy but yet lighter weight than any I could find. I’m a small woman with a bad back, it’s like the ones that my parents and grandpa had. The only one that I could find at Lowe’s, Home Depot, Walmart, two or 3 other places were so heavy I could barely pick-up the pitch fork.
customer_reviews.author: L Craft

customer_reviews.title: Nice and recommended
customer_reviews.text: Super nice tool that was very effective at picking up demo bush debris for many weeks of work in my landscaping business. I had to pick up branches from escalonia and rosemary shrubs. It was about 18 yards of debris. I'd buy it again and again, it is built to last. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: markld

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Spreading Mulch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 10-tine fork for spreading 8 yards of mulch throughout my property. It works great for that purpose. So much easier than trying to dig a shovel into the mound, and you can really pick up a huge amount with it.
customer_reviews.author: 2.5boyds

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for your garden and many other jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this many years ago and used it many times and is just a quality tool, and even today still looks like new, I have left it outside twice in the winter and I have not found any rust on it.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: You need this.  You just don't know it yet.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a little bit but it feels solid. It's a huge savings over the forks I priced locally. I'm using it for mulch and it is wonderful compared to using a shovel. I can fill a 32 gallon can with mulch in about 6 loads. Using a shovel takes much longer and requires much more effort. This is one those tools you don't know you need until you try it. Then it's is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Parnone

customer_reviews.title: Great for wood chips
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to move wood chip piles. Love this thing so much I ordered another one from my cell phone while we were shoveling. Solid and strong. Needed a second one quicker, but box store sites only showed ones with long handles. It feels like you get better leverage with the shorter one. Expect it to be very useful as we continue to build the homestead as well (i.e. whole lot more manure heading our way).
customer_reviews.author: kruncheecon

customer_reviews.title: Great product...handy!
customer_reviews.text: On a small farm, there is a repeated & frequent need for just such a product. So far, the handle (which always seems to be the first thing on these to break) is holding up well. It could be made a little lighter weight but if it were, it probably wouldn't be as strong.
customer_reviews.author: bobm

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving and spreading mulch
customer_reviews.text: Works well for loading shredded hardwood mulch from delivery pile to cart and then to deposit in planter areas. Slides easily into mulch pile and picks up a large quantity of mulch to move to transfer cart and then allows pickup of smaller portions to then evenly distribute in the planter areas so that little further spreading work is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Project Manager

customer_reviews.title: Great compost fork
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my compost pile. I had a 4-tine wooden handle fork and I keep it next to my compost pile. Weather got to it and the handle broke. I checked everywhere locally and couldn't find a resin/plastic handle. Went to Amazon and found the Truper 5-tine at Arett Sales--love it. Love the 5 tines. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Happyfirewater

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pitchfork
customer_reviews.text: I’ve moved about 50 yards of compost with this so far and it works great. I would recommend removing the sticker from the shaft of the handle right away otherwise your hand will get gummy for a few hours as it wears off on it own.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: great for our compost pile
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our compost pile. I was using a five pronged pitch fork to turn the pile and it was constantly getting jammed full of the piles contents. I'd turn a couple of forks full and have to remove the stuck parts from the fork. The three tong fork has solved the problem and has never become clogged. It is also a nice quality product
customer_reviews.author: Gary Anderson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible pitchfork. I used it 2 times and it broke. The company won’t do anything about it. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great for turning my compost piles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to turn my compost pile. It serves that purpose very well. The weight is a tad heavier than I hoped for... but I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LMB-T

customer_reviews.title: The tines bend a bit too easily
customer_reviews.text: If you put much leverage on the fork, the tines bend. It's as though they lack tempering... I don't know. Are my expectations incorrect? possibly.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdinand P. Sanchez III

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but one tine broke off the first week
customer_reviews.text: I am a landscaper and my crew can move more mulch with this tool. My biggest guy broke off one tine in the first week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lighter and I expect longer lasting than wood. More expensive then wood. In my opinion worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Lighter and sturdier. Composting and clean up of masses of tumbleweed. Costs more than wood, but I am getting to the age where I do not have time for the lower quality, lower price tools.
customer_reviews.author: Tomodesert

customer_reviews.title: Commercial Quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mulch fork. I own a lawn care and landscaping business and I put down around 70 yards of mulch a year. This thing is heavy duty and comfortable to hold. I like the fiberglass handle much better than wood. This thing will last a lifetime for sure. I plan to buy more of these in the future to replace my old ones that break. This is top of the line, coming from a lawn professional who uses only the best of the best equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Cutshaw

customer_reviews.title: so much better than a snow shovel !
customer_reviews.text: Have only used for one afternoon to shovel 6 yds of pine bark mulch but can firmly state that it is absolutely worth the price after one use. Quality product and sturdy performance. Saved me a couple of hours in time as able to fill wheelbarrow much more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: KindaHandy17

customer_reviews.title: awesome fork :)
customer_reviews.text: before this i was using a rake plus a shovel to pick up the mulch into a gorilla cart.then a buddy lent me a manure fork.wow i finish loading the cart in about 5-6 minutes now.i highly reccomend this for picking up mulch.looks pretty good.just dont leave the fork out in the sun all day when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosendo

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: The very first time we went to use this to muck out a stall the end fell off. :(
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: It is fairly well made and. the tines seem ...
customer_reviews.text: It is fairly well made and.the tines seem strong. The relatively short length of the handle and the amount of metal in the tines makes it poorly balanced. If I were starting over I would look for one with fewer tines and a longer handle.
customer_reviews.author: David Willis

customer_reviews.title: Gardener helper
customer_reviews.text: I found this tool by accident being used on a uTube video. I am retired due to COVID and decided to expand my garden. This tool is what I used to accomplish this task. My next project for this tool is cleaning out an old flower bed that is now choked with weeds. For this kind of project, I can highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hebert - QuickBooks Pro-Advisor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for turning compost!
customer_reviews.text: Not too big and not too small. Very sturdy. This will not bend. This is exactly what I needed to turn the compost pile but will also be using it all over the garden. So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good tool also called a hay fork
customer_reviews.text: used for shoving tree limbs off truck because it releases like a charm unlike standard pitch forks.
customer_reviews.author: bender101

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: These manure, bedding, silage, mulch, etc. forks are handy as a pocket in a shirt. They work on everything from leaves to straw.
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: Solid no-frills pitchfork.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly built pitchfork that arrived quickly and looks and functions exactly as described by the seller. Though the tines are spaced a bit farther apart than I am used to, but this doesn't hinder the overall functionality of the fork.
customer_reviews.author: Joel W. Côté-Kanning

customer_reviews.title: A tine broke off at the weld the 4th time we used it
customer_reviews.text: It was nice and lightweight but not durable for moving lightweight wood chips. Broke the 4th time we used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Latest two uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the burn pit, keep it in doors when not in use, broke after second time using it. Buy another brand. Fork just came out of the handle and it appears nothing was even holding the two together but air.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: If u need a pitch fork, look no further!  Fantastic quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pitch fork that is already being used! It is a very good quality product and I would recommend it to anyone who needs one! Deliver in a timely fashion also. It has sharp forks and the handle is very comfortable to work with! Use it in our four gardens daily. Couldn't have asked for a better quality product than the truper!! Great product and I would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Thank You!
customer_reviews.text: Best tool there is for moving or turning over a pile of mulch quickly & easily!! I also use it to aerate & mix together clay soil with other soils. It's light weight but very strong. The work I am doing in my yard is too hard without it & anything that lets me still garden/landscape even with arthritis in my hands is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Naturelover

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: would recommend this product to anyone who needs a great pitchfork. Fiberglass handle means we don't need to worry if we leave it outside in the weather. nice long handle too!
customer_reviews.author: Carol J Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, high quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice high quality pitch fork. I use this for turning our mulch pile and it's great. It does tend to catch larger sticks that get stuck due to tine spacing, but if my wood chipper was working properly I wouldn't have sticks in the pile to begin with. I can pick up as heavy a load as I can handle and there is absolutely no flex whatsoever from the handle or the tines. The handle is beefy fiberglass, the grip is nice and thick, and the tines are bigger than they need to be. My kind of tool!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, tines bend very easy, I can bend them back by hand! Won’t pick up too much.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Better then back on the farm
customer_reviews.text: I was raised on a diary farm in Wisconsin and grew up with one of these in my hands. This one is as good or better then the ones I grew up with. Very heavy duty, will last longer then I will. I use it now for easily picking up leaves, garden refuse, clean up after chipping, and working over soil. Can't say that I am in love with it, but it does deserve 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: It is better than what I expected. I was nervous about ordering one on Amazon but it totally worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Grissom

customer_reviews.title: nicely built and great quality
customer_reviews.text: i think this pitch fork should last - it is not a cheaply built tool
customer_reviews.author: Crikey

customer_reviews.title: Great compost fork
customer_reviews.text: Been using for the last few months on turning compost. It's ergonomic and seems sturdy. Comfortable in the hands and lightweight. Will update if any negative changes.
customer_reviews.author: Voluntaryist

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well with the hay - happy with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Gail R.

customer_reviews.title: good hay fork
customer_reviews.text: I like the 3 tine hay forks for getting hay off a round bale.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: handle is splitting in 2 places
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased in march and the fiberglass handle is already splitting. I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R Mandler

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk - Fell apart on 5th use
customer_reviews.text: I liked it until it fell apart. I only do light work at my home and the fork head fell off the handle with the 5th use. It has a "lifetime warranty" but no one will honor it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The big Fork.
customer_reviews.text: I like this. Hard to find one this wide. I bought another one that I thought was wide, and it wasn't wide at all. This fork will really pick up a bunch of leaves at once. And it isn't heavy.
customer_reviews.author: robby tharp

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for mulch
customer_reviews.text: I use this to mulch at my house every year. I can lay down about 7 yards of mulch in about 2 hours using this fork. It makes quick work of a job that is usually pretty tedious. I thought that a big scoop shovel and a rake was the best way to go until my neighbor let me borrow one of these. I immediately searched out where to buy one and Amazon was the best priced. This is a good quality fork and should meet your needs well for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ESH

customer_reviews.title: Killer Deal
customer_reviews.text: Went to my local hardware store, their pitchfork was not half as nice as this one...for the same price (ie wooden handle, no handle foam, etc) This pitchfork is awesome. I use it to remove tumbleweeds. The tines seem to be (almost) teflon coated. I am sure the tines are probably painted with some high quality "baked on enamel paint". I love the fiberglass handle, with durable foam..... Buy it, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Oliver Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: It's a well built pitch fork what else is there to say abut a pitch fork.
customer_reviews.author: DOC

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Using it for hay. Slides off way easier than my old one
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in great shape and ready to go
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I got a fully assembled pitchfork on Amazon. Arrived in great shape and ready to go. I don't have piles of manure, but I do use it for my compost pile and mulch distribution. I am a big fan of fiberglass handles and the tines are strong and sharp. For the same or better price than local, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Quality mulch fork at the lowest price
customer_reviews.text: Great for scooping bulk mulch. I remulched my beds this year, it took 4 yards of triple shred. Decided to buy this instead of using a square transfer shovel and saved a lot of time! Half the price of the Big Box Stores.
customer_reviews.author: bridges9129

customer_reviews.title: Good fork. Balanced well and a definate plus with the fiberglass handle.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a variety of gardening things. Picking up brambles, wood chips, etc. Also due to the handle being fiberglass I won't have to worry so much about the Oregon rain rotting it. The balance seems to be good as well.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality manure/bedding/(compost) fork
customer_reviews.text: This was not too heavy for me and I'm a 5' 135 lb. senior. It cut my work in half. Very pleased with the quality of this bedding fork, which I use for composting.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Freewriter

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Has many uses. Not only for doing things like sifting through dirt or shavings, but also for aerating the soil on a garden bed. I chose this brand because of the D hande; I findi it easier to hold on to.
customer_reviews.author: CAThy H

customer_reviews.title: I like this. As long as I can keep some ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this. As long as I can keep some dummy from using it as a pry bar, I'll have a good pitch fork.
customer_reviews.author: Darlaquilts

customer_reviews.title: A great yard tool
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a three tined fork for a long time. I found this on Amazon, ordered it and have been very pleased with it. You can pick up large bundles of brush and weeds with this fork and fling them into your cart or wagon.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Skirtz

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The head came off of the fork the first time I tried to use it. Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Nice to see there are still garden tools around that have some heft to them. Yes, it's forged in Mexico, but just goes to show, if an American mfgr. specifies quality, they get quality. A bit on the heavy side, but hey, I doubt if it'll break!
customer_reviews.author: North Port Guy

customer_reviews.title: Forking Phantistic!
customer_reviews.text: One of my go to garden tools. Will probably hand this down to my grandchildren. Well made. Perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Augustin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I love that the blade is slanted/arced ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I love that the blade is slanted/arced as it provide for more leverage and getting larger payloads in one scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Larson

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I've left this outside in the elements, there's no rust and feels very strong and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Mulch fork is extra wide
customer_reviews.text: I love the width of the mulch / bedding fork.
customer_reviews.author: Gatto Landscaping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Strong, well built . It is light weight and strong and easy to grab.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Professionally made, strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: This pitchfork is strong and professionally made. I expect it will provide many years of service. The size and weight are just right for turning compost and digging light soil. It arrived from Amazon in perfect condition and I though it was definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: 70 plus

customer_reviews.title: Do you really ever turn your compost heap?
customer_reviews.text: We use this fine fork on our huge compost heap. It has made the turning of the heap, theretofore almost never done because it is to messy and clumsy and hard work, into something we actually do and are happy doing it.
customer_reviews.author: sitkacook

customer_reviews.title: Make your life easier in the barn. You’ll never go back to a smaller fork again.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Makes cleaning stalls a breeze. They are heavier than your normal pitch fork. I feel like they need to be with the larger forks. I have bought 3 now and won’t buy any other for my barn.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Keller

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well for horse manure
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this product for cleaning up after our quarter horse and arabian cross.horse. Unfortunately, the tines are too far apart to pick up manure well. Most of it falls through. I was also disappointed in Amazon's shipping. I have a Prime account and opted for 2 day shipping. However, they sent it ground and it took 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jen W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s big and well made. My husband said it takes a man to use it.🙂
customer_reviews.author: seven sisters

customer_reviews.title: Bent from different size wood chips
customer_reviews.text: works great for nice mulch - used for wood chips (uneven sizes) and the twines all bent from the different sizes of the chips and a few broke off. I bent the twines back but now they continuously bend from any weight. Worthless now but was my fault for using on wood chips. Don't use on wood chips!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for bedding but tines are too far apart for manure
customer_reviews.author: GiddyYuppy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, high-quality product. The only thing that would make it better would be if it came with a person who would spread the 10 cu. yds. of shredded bark I have. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Dataman

customer_reviews.title: He really liked it, great quality and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a Christmas present. He really liked it, great quality and very sturdy. He was impressed, and it's American made! Can't go wrong with it!
customer_reviews.author: Martis721

customer_reviews.title: Super Truper
customer_reviews.text: Love this pitchfork! Not too heavy, but handles a heavy scoop of straw with no trouble. Pricy, but so far, well worth the $. Made to last a lifetime, and comes with warranty to back it up.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Decent tool made for real work including working farms. Not high end, and won't last forever if used hard, but decent value and reasonable weight to strength ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Luke B. Townsley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: When doing yard work I have wanted a fork like this, love it
customer_reviews.author: William I Porfily

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. Works great on leaves and compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: Janice welch

customer_reviews.title: Good fiberlgass handles
customer_reviews.text: Finally I found some pitchforks like this with fiberglass handles. They are strong and lightweight, I can also leave them on my truck without the wood weathering, rotting or splintering. They are much more comfortable to use than the wooden ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cornflake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING product!!! Was very well made. Bought two other tools by the same manufacturer - love them all!
customer_reviews.author: GEOFnCARYN

customer_reviews.title: Unground welds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fork. I noticed 3 welds (attaching tines) that had razor sharp metal attached. I believe that a serious injury would of happened.
customer_reviews.author: Marci

customer_reviews.title: Fork
customer_reviews.text: Hay forks seem hard to find these days. This one is very rugged; perhaps more than a hay fork needs to be. My father's old fork was lighter and easier to lift. This one will work but it's a bit heavier than needed.
customer_reviews.author: Study For Knowledge

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime warranty on handle
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Right length,nice fiberglass handle, 5tines( better than 4, for me).
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my wife and she loves it moving ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife and she loves it moving around the leaves I pile up in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: Randy V.

customer_reviews.title: Great pitchfork
customer_reviews.text: I use this to turn my compost pile. It does what I expect a pitchfork to do. Nice cushioned handle, nice shaped pointy end. Would buy this again. A little annoying to unwrap the tape, but that's the price you pay for protection
customer_reviews.author: Chunkychen

customer_reviews.title: Fork is a good replacement for heirloom that was lost.
customer_reviews.text: Well built fork- good balance and handling. Not so light weight, but really OK for general farm and maintenance work. It replaced a heirloom fork that disappeared. Good replacement, but heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Rockon777

customer_reviews.title: A good tool
customer_reviews.text: This pitchfork is very well made and ergonomically considerate in the placing of the grips. Past pitchforks have lasted me a few years. I think this one will outlast the others. The only thing that would make it better is to include someone to use it.
customer_reviews.author: jimhammer1

customer_reviews.title: Love This Fork!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, solid. This is a nice piece of equipment. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Hane in Houston

customer_reviews.title: ... hold on to the tines but otherwise it's a good strong handle and tines
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the screw in the handle to hold on to the tines but otherwise it's a good strong handle and tines. Nice handle length.
customer_reviews.author: T. Buchner

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and well made. Not too heavy for 120lb me, but strong enough to turn my compost without bending. Nice hand grip. V happy with my purchase. Recommended to everyone, except maybe someone wanting an heirloom too with a wood handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: It pitches the hay
customer_reviews.text: Best pitch fork I have had sense my old one was eaten by the hay grinder. Good broad tines, strong handle, and well built.... Best fork on prime!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Truper manure fork
customer_reviews.text: The fork seems to be very well made, but I will not be using it for what it was made for. I have modified the fork to be used for my purpose and it came out very well and although I have not used it yet I believe it will work very well for what I am going to be using it for.
customer_reviews.author: poop deck pappy

product_meta.title: Truper 30299 Tru Pro Spading Fork, 4-Tine, Fiberglass D-Handle, 30-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:30-Inch| Style:Tru Pro - Spading Fork 4-TineTruper 30299, BJ-4F, Tru Pro Spading Fork, 4-Tine, Fiberglass D-Handle, 30-Inch. 30" Pro Grade fiberglass handle with D-grip handle for balance and control. White Ash handles give optimum ratio of resistance and flexibility. 4 tine spading fork with 30" fiberglass handle. For Commercial, Industrial use; AG, Dairy, Farm, ranch for a lifetime of use. Tru pro is the contractors choice for professional use. Truper has been in the hand tool manufacturing business for over 40 years and is by far the largest Mexican company in its field. Truper relies on the most advanced modern and efficient technology to guarantee the optimum quality and value of its products and demanding service needs of the company's global customers.. Tru Pro is a premium line true to the specs of contractor-grade tools. The unit is also geared at the consumer who wishes to step up to high-end tools. Best Value at the top end of the market. Tru-Pro products features the heaviest gauge heads available, tab sockets or steel collars, along with a select choice of white ashwood handles for the optimum ratio of resistance and flexibility. Lifetime warranty backs all Tru-pro tools.
